ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: What do you feel is the level of your financial stress today?
Notes: 1 = Overwhelming stress; 4 = High stress; 7 = Low stress; 10 = No stress at all

ElementDescription: How satisfied you are with your present financial situation?
How do you feel about your current financial situation?
Notes: 1 = Feel Overwhelmed; 4 = Sometimes feel worried; 7 = Not worried; 10 = Feel comfortable

ElementDescription: How often do you worry about being able to meet normal monthly living expenses?
Notes: 1 = Worry all the time; 4 = Sometimes worry; 7 = Rarely worry; 10 = Never worry

ElementDescription: How confident are you that you could find the money to pay for a financial emergency that costs about $1,000?
Notes: 1 = No confidence; 4 = Little confidence; 7 = Some confidence; 10 = High confidence

ElementDescription: How often does this happen to you? You want to go out to eat, go to a movie or do something else and don't go because you can't afford to?
Notes: 1 = All the time; 4 Sometimes; 7 = Rarely; 10 = Never

ElementDescription: How frequently do you find yourself just getting by financially and living paycheck to paycheck?
Notes: 1 = All the time; 4 Sometimes; 7 = Rarely; 10 = Never

ElementDescription: How stressed do you feel about your personal finances in general?
Notes: 1 = Overwhelming stress; 4 = High stress; 7 = Low stress; 10 = No stress at all
